about.help: Ligation and Transformation was retrieved from Youtube from the channel J. Christopher Anderson, and was created on 5/15/2014.

contents.params: Ligation is the process of joining linear DNAs with similar ends together forming covalent bonds between them.  This 'closes the circle' on a plasmid DNA making them amenable to replication in vivo.  We then introduce them into cells by transformation.  By incubating specially-treated E. coli bacteria with the DNA and applying a heat pulse, the DNA enters the cell and begin replicating.
